title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Brandon Rose. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Using API Tokens
text: time writting article 53 API methods redcap. 52 accessible regular user token. 1 requires super token. 27 methods exports; 14 imports; 8 deletes; 4 .

title: Using API Tokens
text: RosyREDCap intentionally avoids modifying metadata user DAGs using API, choosing instead focus primarily exporting relevant data advanced users, giving access uploads, files, file repository. current RosyREDCap API coverage 26 52 available methods (50%). Crucially, standardized behind wrappers. user can leverage methods handful key functions. short package loads last save (setup_DB load_DB), checks log updates, gets changes local object (update_DB). multiple projects can toggle projects can create custom outputs derived feed (run_RosyREDCap). Notice: method’s destructive nature, available use projects Development status. Additionally, please aware deleting event automatically delete records/data collected event (non-reversible data loss). value pair. ‘invitation_sent_status’ ‘0’ invitation yet sent participant, ‘1’ . ‘invitation_send_time’ date/time next invitation sent, blank invitation scheduled sent. ‘response_status’ represents Please note method may used Signature fields (.e. File Upload fields ‘signature’ validation type) signature can captured stored using web interface. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_file |POST |NA |token | content | action | record | field | event | repeat_instance | file | returnFormat |token | content | action | record | field | event | repeat_instance | file |returnFormat | |imp_inst_event_maps |Import Instrument-Event Mappings |import |formEventMapping |NA |method allows import Instrument-Event Mappings project (corresponds ‘Designate Instruments Events’ page project). NOTE: works longitudinal projects. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_inst_event_maps |POST |Number Instrument-Event Mappings imported |token | content | format | data | returnFormat |token | content | format | data |returnFormat | |imp_metadata |Import Metadata (Data Dictionary) |import |metadata |NA |method allows import metadata (.e., Data Dictionary) project. Notice: method’s destructive nature, available use projects Development status. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_metadata |POST |Number fields imported |token | content | format | data | returnFormat |token | content | format | data |returnFormat | |imp_proj_sett |Import Project Information |import |project_settings |NA |method allows update basic attributes given REDCap project, project’s title, longitudinal, surveys enabled, etc. data format corresponds format API method Export Project Information. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_proj_sett |POST |Returns number values accepted updated project settings (including values remained import). |token | content | format | data |token | content | format | data | | |imp_proj |Create New Project |create |project |NA |method allows create new REDCap project. 64-character Super API Token required method (opposed project-level API methods require regular 32-character token associated project-user). API request, must minimally provide project attributes ‘project_title’ ‘purpose’ (numerical value 0=Practice/Just fun, 1=, 2=Research, 3=Quality Improvement, 4=Operational Support) creating project. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_proj |POST |project created, 32-character project-level API Token returned (associated project user creating project). token ostensibly used make subsequent API calls project, adding new events, fields, records, etc. |token | content | format | returnFormat | odm |token | content | format |returnFormat | odm | |imp_records |Import Records |import |record |NA |method allows import set records project |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_records |POST |content specified returnContent |token | content | format | dateFormat | csvDelimiter | returnContent | returnFormat |token | content | format |dateFormat | csvDelimiter | returnContent | returnFormat | |imp_repeating_forms_events |Import Repeating Instruments Events |import |repeatingFormsEvents |NA |method allows import list repeated instruments repeating events project. includes unique instrument name seen second column Data Dictionary, well repeating instrument’s corresponding custom repeating instrument label. longitudinal projects, unique event name also needed repeating instrument. Additionally, repeating events must submitted separate items, instrument name blank/null indicate repeating event (rather repeating instrument). |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_repeating_forms_events |POST |Number repeated isntruments repeated events imported |token | content | format | data | returnFormat |token | content | format | data |returnFormat | |imp_user_dag_maps |Import User-DAG Assignments |import |userDagMapping |import |method allows assign users data access group. NOTE: wish modify existing mapping, must provide unique username group name. ‘redcap_data_access_group’ column provided, user assigned group. one record per username. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_user_dag_maps |POST |Number User-DAG assignments added updated |token | content | action | format | data | returnFormat |token | content | action | format | data |returnFormat | |imp_user_role_maps |Import User-Role Assignments |import |userRoleMapping |import |method allows assign users user role. NOTE: wish modify existing mapping, must provide unique username role name. ‘unique_role_name’ column provided, user assigned user role. one record per username. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_user_role_maps |POST |Number User-Role assignments added updated |token | content | action | format | returnFormat |token | content | action | format |returnFormat | |imp_user_roles |Import User Roles |import |userRole |NA |method allows import new user roles project setting privileges, update privileges existing user roles project. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_user_roles |POST |Number user roles added updated |token | content | format | returnFormat |token | content | format |returnFormat | |imp_users |Import Users |import |user |NA |method allows import new users project setting user privileges, update privileges existing users project. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=imp_users |POST |Number users added updated |token | content | format | returnFormat |token | content | format |returnFormat | |rename_record |Rename Record |rename |record |rename |method allows rename record project single API request. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=rename_record |POST |Returns “1” record renamed error message . |token | content | action | record | new_record_name | arm |token | content | action | record | new_record_name |arm | |switch_dag |Switch DAG |switch |dag |switch |method allows current API user switch (assign/reassign/unassign) current Data Access Group assignment assigned multiple DAGs via DAG Switcher page project. |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/ |https://redcap.miami.edu/api/help/?content=switch_dag |POST |Returns “1” current API user switched specified Data Access Group, otherwise returns error message. |token | content | action | dag |token | content | action | dag | |

title: Get Started
text: get REDCap turned R database… can set REDCap token three ways! need help setting tokens see article –> placeholder
code: library("RosyREDCap")  projects <- get_projects() # get list of cached projects  View(projects) # show your previously saved projects  DB <- setup_DB(   short_name = "TEST",   redcap_base_link = "https://redcap.miami.edu/", # change to your institutions link   dir_path = getwd(), # or change to your intended file path   # force = T, # use this to force a refresh   merge_form_name = "patient",   use_csv = FALSE, # if you don't have Microsoft change to TRUE   auto_check_token = TRUE ) #1. set each time in your session (not recommended in saved/shared scripts!) Sys.setenv(RosyREDCap_token_TEST = "YoUrNevErShaReToken")  #2. set to your private R sessions! usethis::edit_r_environ() #finds your file # Then you add --> RosyREDCap_token_TEST = 'YoUrNevErShaReToken' # then save file and restart R  # If it worked you will see your token when you run... Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") #And if your DB object is setup properly... #3. Using the REDCap console DB<-load_DB("TEST") set_REDCap_token(DB) # can see if it's set correctly view_REDCap_token(DB)

title: Get Started
text: following functions represent core functions package.
code: DB <- update_DB(DB) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object   DB <- add_forms_transformation_to_DB(DB,forms_tranformation = default_forms_transformation(DB))  DB <- transform_DB(DB) # transform to most basic forms, can be modified  DB <- drop_redcap_dir(DB)  #run shiny app! run_RosyREDCap()  # dev functions not ready for public yet DB <- clean_DB(DB) DB <- summarize_DB(DB) #can use for subsets! DB <- summarize_DB(DB) DB %>% save_summary() # will save summary data, look at the tabs!

title: Get Started
code: DB$metadata %>% add_list_to_global()  DB$data %>% add_list_to_global()  #DB$summary %>% add_list_to_global() #not ready for public  listviewer::jsonedit(DB) # view object

title: Tokens
text: REDCap API tokens equivalent username password. never shared anyone. Ideally, never directly written R script, especially plan sharing future. Never commit file containing token git GitHub forever history. ever doubt mind quickly regenerate token REDCap website. working real REDCap project ’s good practice regenerate token periodically, week, just safe. Precisely tokens sensitive, RosyREDCap designed reference name token, “RosyREDCap_token_TEST”. RosyREDCap ever wants use token make API call REDCap, check Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST"). default token names start “RosyREDCap_token_”, followed short_name chose setup_DB().demonstrates set check tokens…

what: Setting Your Token for One Session
title: Tokens
text: can also set manually base R. Unless specifically set token Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") blank. Now token set R session . restarted R, blank .
code: library("RosyREDCap") Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") #>[1] "" # Assuming you already setup or loaded a DB object you can set the token like this... DB <- load_DB("TEST") set_REDCap_token(DB) # Set your token manually Sys.setenv(RosyREDCap_token_TEST="a_FaKe_TOkEn") # again having this in a script is not advised but possible  # Get your token Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") #>[1] "a_FaKe_TOkEn"

what: Setting Your Token for Any Session
title: Tokens
text: may find want reuse token, may several projects, convenient way store tokens separate location. One way personal .Renviron file. , check always confirm location file make sure ’s part cloud storage git GitHub. can use usethis::edit_r_environ() semi-permanently save token. time launch R session file run token visible specifically called Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST"). Open .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ() Add token like … RosyREDCap_token_TEST = "faKeTokeN" Save file Close Restart R Session (Session tab .rs.restartR()). Confirm Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") reference token ever made saved RosyREDCap name. example, RosyREDCap DB object token name DB$token_name. future, may set token different way.
code: #Install usethis if you don't have it. #install.packages("usethis")  usethis::edit_r_environ() # Now save your token.... (without the comment symbol '#') # RosyREDCap_token_TEST = "faKeTokeN" # Save the file and Close # Restart R Session (session tab) # .rs.restartR() # this will also restart R session for you. Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") # now should contain your token

title: RosyREDCap
text: Use REDCap API tokens create updating R list object (DB) can used downstream analysis, data exports, shiny apps, data imports! Rosy capital ‘R’ evokes R statistical programming language, primary developer’s last name, idea making something beautiful user-friendly. prefix combined REDCap demonstrates package’s goal enhancing REDCap experience creating data tools powerful pleasant use, combining best R best REDCap. time package suited Multi-Arm projects massive REDCap projects yet. come future versions! core functions stable future development changes possible.

title: RosyREDCap
text: R (ideally RStudio) installed computer. Access least one REDCap project (real test) API Token Privileges according User Rights. Permission export analyze date project.

title: RosyREDCap
text: R REDCap widely utilized medicine, including basic science, clinical research, clinal trials. independent strengths, together can create powerful data pipelines. several R packages exist extracting data using REDCap API, RosyREDCap stands offering comprehensive extraction metadata data REDCap project standardized R list object, facilitating effortless downstream use exports, imports, transformation, applications. showcased exploratory data analysis shiny app included package. three core aims RosyREDCap … Maintain local version database (DB) object calling recently updated records using REDCap log. Allow imports non-coded versions dataset using R Excel/CSV. Launch shiny app allows explore REDCap projects. leveraging combined strengths R REDCap, users can maintain strong clinical data pipelines, collected processed appropriately improve research patient care. RosyREDCap can used base data object data quality tool REDCap projects aid collection, monitoring, transformation, analysis.

title: RosyREDCap

Feel free browse package NEWS. stable release can found CRAN installed : PLACEHOLDER SUBMITTED CRAN YET can install development version RosyREDCap GitHub using remotes package. sure install remotes don’t already. See thecodingdocs.com/r/getting-started.

title: RosyREDCap
code: library("RosyREDCap")  projects <- get_projects() # get list of cached projects print.data.frame(projects) # show your previously saved projects  your_project_path <- getwd() print(your_project_path) # confirm this is where you want files saved  DB <- setup_DB(   short_name = "TEST",   redcap_base_link = "https://redcap.yourinstitution.edu/", # change to your institutions link (stop at ".edu/")   dir_path = getwd() # or change to your intended file path ) #defaults will autocheck for valid token or ask you.  #if you had to set a token above you might need to select the code below again for it to run DB <- update_DB(DB) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object   DB <- DB %>% deidentify_DB(drop_free_text = F) %>% drop_REDCap_to_directory() # will save DEIDENTIFIED data (assuming this is set up properly on REDCap) #use drop_free_text = T to be even safer  # DB <- drop_REDCap_to_directory(DB) # will save IDENTIFIED data (assuming this is set up properly on REDCap)  #run shiny app! run_RosyREDCap() # will work with multiple REDCap projects!

title: Check the REDCap Log — get_REDCap_log
text: Retrieve analyze REDCap log monitor recent activity filter specific users time ranges.

title: Check the REDCap Log — get_REDCap_log
code: get_REDCap_log(   DB,   last = 24,   user = "",   units = "hours",   begin_time = "",   clean = T,   record = "" )

title: Check the REDCap Log — get_REDCap_log
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using `load_DB()` `setup_DB()` last Numeric. Specifies time range paired `units` filter log. Default `24`. user Character. Optional user filter retrieve log entries associated specific username. Default empty string (`""`), includes users. units Character. Units paired `last` define time range. Options `"mins"`, `"hours"`, `"days"`. Default `"hours"`. begin_time Character. specific timestamp (e.g., "2023-07-11 13:15:06") define start log retrieval. Overrides `last` `units` provided. Default empty string (`""`). clean Logical. `TRUE`, cleans API data adds extra summary columns log. Default `TRUE`. record Character. Optional record filter retrieving log entries associated specific record. Default empty string (`""`).

title: Check the REDCap Log — get_REDCap_log
text: `data.frame` containing cleaned summarized REDCap log.

title: Check the REDCap Log — get_REDCap_log
text: function queries REDCap project log retrieve recent activity based specified time range, user, starting timestamp. optionally cleans raw API data adds summary columns enhance log readability analysis.

title: run_RosyREDCap — run_RosyREDCap
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_REDCap_token

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_REDCap_token
Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_REDCap_token
text: ask Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, asks user confirmation overwriting existing valid token. Default `TRUE`.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_REDCap_token
text: Invisible. message printed confirm token successfully set.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_REDCap_token
text: valid token already exists R session, function notifies user asks whether want replace . user guided provide new token console. strongly discouraged include API tokens directly within R scripts. token validated internally stored using `Sys.setenv()`.

what: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
text: Setup Load `DB` object necessary REDCap API token configurations.

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
code: setup_DB(   short_name,   dir_path,   redcap_base,   force = F,   merge_form_name = "merged",   use_csv = F,   auto_check_token = T )  load_DB(short_name, dir_path, validate = T)

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
text: short_name character string spaces symbols representing unique short name REDCap project. dir_path Optional character string representing directory path want REDCap project data stored. missing, DB object current R session. redcap_base character string representing base URL REDCap server. force Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, forces setup even `DB` object already exists. Default `FALSE`. merge_form_name character string representing name merged form. Default "merged". use_csv Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses CSV files data storage. Default `FALSE`. auto_check_token Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, automatically checks validity REDCap API token. Default `TRUE`.

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
text: RosyREDCap `DB` list object.

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
text: function sets `DB` object storing REDCap API token configurations required interacting REDCap server. ensures token valid ready use subsequent API calls. Neither function directly attempts communication REDCap. `setup_DB` used first time initialize/link REDCap project. Mainly, sets unique `short_name` intended directory. Unless run force = TRUE default first try load_DB. dir_path technically optional without user save/load/update projects. `load_DB` can used just `short_name` parameter already run `setup_DB` past established directory. `dir_path` optional function can used relocated directory.

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
code: if (FALSE) { # Initialize the DB object with the REDCap API token and URL DB <- setup_DB(   short_name = "TEST",   dir_path = "path/to/secure/file/storage",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.yourinstitution.edu/" ) DB <- load_DB("TEST") }

Test REDCap API Token linked to a DB Object — test_REDCap_token
text: set_if_fails Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE test connection fails, asks user paster token consult using `set_REDCap_token(DB)` function. Default `TRUE`. launch_browser Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, launches REDCap login page default web browser validation fails. Default `TRUE`.

title: Test REDCap API Token linked to a DB Object — test_REDCap_token
text: Logical. Returns `TRUE` API token valid, otherwise `FALSE`.

title: Test REDCap API Token linked to a DB Object — test_REDCap_token
text: function tests whether API token stored `DB` object valid making request REDCap server. token invalid, function can optionally open REDCap login page browser (`launch_browser`) /reset token (`set_if_fails`) using console.

title: View the REDCap API Token Stored in the Session — view_REDCap_token
